‘Spiral Bite’ is a compact, carnivorous strain of common whelk (Buccinum undatum) engineered for integrated multi-trophic aquaculture (IMTA) in brackish urban systems. This cultivar develops the characteristic spiral shell with deep siphonal canal, but at a miniature 3-4 cm length, making it ideal for container cultivation. Thriving in brackish conditions where freshwater and marine systems meet, ‘Spiral Bite’ serves as a valuable cleanup crew by consuming detritus and leftover feed, while developing a rich, complex flavor prized in seafood cuisine.
